DataElement.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale 10 Last 2 Weeks Bowel Problems Frequency Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation in the last two weeks describing their bowel problems, diarrhea, rectal discomfort (pain, burning or irritation) or constipation, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Past 2 Weeks Bowel Problems Frequency Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer._A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present._A question about the frequency of an individual's bowel problems._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Concepts.definition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Property.preferredName: Past 2 Weeks Bowel Problems Frequency Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.:A question about the frequency of an individual's bowel problems.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.
A question about the frequency of an individual's bowel problems.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Bowel Problem 4 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No Diarrhea, Rectal Discomfort, or Constipation

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No Diarrhea, Rectal Discomfort, or Constipation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no diarrhea, rectal discomfort, or constipation.

Concepts.longName: No Diarrhea, Rectal Discomfort, or Constipation
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no diarrhea, rectal discomfort, or constipation.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Have Occasional Diarrhea, Rectal Discomfort, or Constipation

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Have Occasional Diarrhea, Rectal Discomfort, or Constipation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual occasionally has or had diarrhea, rectal discomfort, or constipation.

Concepts.longName: Have Occasional Diarrhea, Rectal Discomfort, or Constipation
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual occasionally has or had diarrhea, rectal discomfort, or constipation.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Have Frequent Diarrhea, Rectal Discomfort, or Constipation

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Have Frequent Diarrhea, Rectal Discomfort, or Constipation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual frequently has or had diarrhea, rectal discomfort, or constipation.

Concepts.longName: Have Frequent Diarrhea, Rectal Discomfort, or Constipation
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual frequently has or had diarrhea, rectal discomfort, or constipation.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Have Nearly Constant Diarrhea, Rectal Discomfort, or Constipation

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Have Nearly Constant Diarrhea, Rectal Discomfort, or Constipation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual nearly always has or had diarrhea, rectal discomfort, or constipation.

Concepts.longName: Have Nearly Constant Diarrhea, Rectal Discomfort, or Constipation
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual nearly always has or had diarrhea, rectal discomfort, or constipation.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Please choose the statement t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please choose the statement that comes closest to describing your bowel problems or constipation.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000
